== Life and career ==

== Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings =
section: == Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Demet Akalın was born on 23 April 1972 to Ali and Şenay Akalın in Gölcük, Kocaeli.
section: == Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Her paternal family has Laz ancestry, while her maternal grandmother, Iffet Hanim (1912-2011), was of Tatar descent and her maternal grandfather was of Bosniak descent.
section: == Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She attended primary and secondary schools in Gölcük and eventually got enrolled in Gölcük Barbaros Hayrettin Lisesi.
section: == Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: With the help of her mother, she took modeling courses with Yaşar Alptekin.
section: == Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She subsequently joined Neşe Erberk's modeling agency.
section: == Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Meanwhile, she acted in a number of movies and TV series including Günlerden Pazar (1992), Tele Anahtar (1994) and Sensiz Olmaz (1994).
section: == Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She also appeared in a TV movie titled Hayatın Anlamı alongside Ece Sükan.
section: == Life and career == | === 1972–96: Early life and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===
== Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: While continuing her modeling career, Akalın started to sing at casinos as well.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: In September 1996, her first studio album Sebebim (My Reason) was released by Elenor Plak.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: The songs were a mix of pop and Arabesque.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: Naim Dilmener wrote in his review for Hürriyet that Akalın was still inexperienced and her shaky vocals made the album poorly received.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: The album's lead single, titled "Sebebim", was written by Seda Akay and Niran Ünsal, for which a music video was released.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: Two other music videos were made for the songs "Asla Affedilmez" and "Sakın Vazgeçme".
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: In 1998 Akalın got a role as Deniz in one episode of Kanal D's TV series Sibel.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: In June 2000 her first EP Yalan Sevdan was released by Şahin Özer Müzik.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: A music video was made for the EP's song "Senin Anan Güzel mi?", which became Akalın's first hit in Turkey and Sırma Karasu of Habertürk later praised the song as one of the earliest examples of modern Turkish pop music.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: Akalın's second studio album Unuttum (I've Forgotten) was produced by Peker Müzik and released in June 2003.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: All of the new songs in the album were written by Ersay Üner and three music videos were made for the album's lead single, "Unuttum", as well as the songs "Gazete" and "Allahından Bul".
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: In December 2004, her third album Banane (I Don't Care) was released by Seyhan Müzik.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: The songs on this album were written by Serdar Ortaç and Yıldız Tilbe.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: The album sold 40,000 copies and eight music videos were made for the songs "Bittim", "Aşkın Açamadığı Kapı", "Banane", "Vuracak", "Bir Anda Sevmiştim", "Tamamdır", "Pembe Dizi" and "Adam Gibi", the second of which was chosen as the Song of the Year at the 12th Turkey Music Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: Critics drew similarities between "Banane"'s music vido and Madonna's short film "Star" made in 2002 for BMW.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: Akalın's future husband, Oğuz Kayhan, appeared in the music video for "Pembe Dizi".
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2005: Sebebim, Unuttum and Banane ===

sentences: Akalın wrote a few songs for her fourth studio album Kusursuz 19 (The Perfect 19) which was produced by Seyhan Müzik and released in June 2006.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: The album was released with high hopes to make Akalın a solid figure of Turkish pop music as, in Akalın's words, "Hande Yener was a bit distressed because her new tape was very European, and Gülşen was having problems due to her troubled relationship with her producer.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: As they are dealing with their problems and losing blood, I will take my place in the music market with my new album."
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: The album sold 147,000 copies, got a gold certification from Mü-Yap and its lead single "Afedersin" became a number-one hit on Türkçe Top 20.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: Separate music videos were also made for the songs "Herkes Hakettiği Gibi Yaşıyor", "Mantık Evliliği" and "Alçak".
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: Akalın received the award for Best Female Artist at the 13th Turkey Music Awards and "Afedersin" was chosen as the Best Song of the Year.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: In July 2006, she married restaurant owner Oğuz Kayhan and the couple got divorced in November.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: Akalın later stated that they were divorced because they had fallen in disagreement about having children.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: Akalın did not intend to release any new works for a period of time, but at the request of her fans, she eventually released the single "Tatil" in June.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: Meanwhile, she got into a feud with Hande Yener.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: Yener had said: "I do western music, so I can not compete with those who make fantasy music.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: What Demet does is not similar to my style." to which Akalın responded by saying: "If she does not like me, why is she after my works?
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: It is obvious that she takes all the works that I don't like or refuse to do for herself."
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: Yener subsequently took a case to the court asking for ₺50,000 on the grounds that Akalın had insulted her and attacked her verbally, but the court said that they did not find any insult in Akalın's words.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: The feud continued when Yener said: "Demet?

sentences: She's a grocery singer.

sentences: What she does is 'grocery music'.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: No doubt.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: The likes of her are the followers of Serdar Ortaç."
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: Akalın responded by saying: "Oh, she does electronic music?
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: It's more likely that she's been electrocuted." and won ₺10,000 in the court in a case against Yener.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: Hürriyet chose the phrase 'grocery music' as one of the core words of 2007 and Sırma Karasu from Habertürk described the grocery music debate as one of the breaking points of Turkish pop music.

sentences: After this point, the feud between the two continued on numerous occasions.

sentences: Akalın's fifth studio album Dans Et (Dance) was produced by Seyhan Müzik and released in March 2008 with Ersay Üner writing and composing most of the songs.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: By the end of the year it sold 128,000 copies in Turkey and received a gold certification from Mü-Yap.

sentences: Critics reacted negatively to slow-paced songs but praised the dance songs.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: The lead single "Mucize" ranked number one on Billboard Türkiye's Türkçe Top 20 for seven weeks.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: After making a music video for "Mucize", separate music videos were released for the songs "Bebek", "Gururum" and "Dans Et".

sentences: "Bebek" became the third most-played song on radio in Turkey in 2008.

sentences: At a concert in Bodrum in May 2008 Akalın said to a group of audience: "Bro, are you all from Diyarbakır?

sentences: From the mountain side?
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: I didn't understand where you came from.

sentences: You're just looking like morons.

sentences: One gives a round of applause or something."
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: These words made her subject to a large number of reactions.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: She responded by saying: "The words I have said were a joke at my own friends from Diyarbakır who had come to see my performance.
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: If the joke I made with all my sincerity towards my friends has been misunderstood, I apologize to all my fans from Diyarbakır."
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: The criticism continued and seven businessmen from Diyarbakır accused Akalın of "publicly denouncing a section of society based on social class, sex, and regional difference".
section: == Life and career == | === 2006–09: Kusursuz 19 and Dans Et ===

sentences: In 2010, the court decided to postpone the announcement of the judgment and, as a precautionary measure, the singer was ordered to write the words of the İstiklal Marşı on a page and make a five-page comment on the anthem.

sentences: In April 2009, Akalın released the single "Toz Pembe", which ranked number one on Türkçe Top 20.

sentences: While the song was favorably received by some critics, it was considered by some as a replay of the singer's previous works.

sentences: The album itself became the best-selling album in Turkey, and sold 105,000 copies, receiving a gold certification from DMC.

sentences: Following "Ders Olsun", new music videos were released for the songs "Gölge", "Çalkala", "Beş Yıl", "Pırlanta" and "Şerefime Namusuma".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: In the same year in August, Akalın took part in the first season of TV8's singing competition Rising Star Türkiye as a judge alongside Gülben Ergen, Fuat Güner and Mustafa Sandal.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: In February 2016, Akalın was cast in a supporting role together with her husband in Osman Pazarlama.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: In November, her tenth studio album Rakipsiz (Unrivaled) was released and its lead single, "Hayalet", became a number-one hit on the official music chart for two weeks.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: On 11 September 2018, Akalın and her husband Okan Kurt divorced due to "irreconcilable differences".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: Their daughter's custody was given to Akalın.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: Akalın's house was reportedly being under the threat of confiscation due to the debts of Martaş Logistics, a company run by her husband's family.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: The couple later reconciled in late November 2018, but are not legally married.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: By the end of the year, Akalın and fellow singer Hande Yener reconciled after an 11-year feud which made them the subject of many tabloid news.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: Akalın's eleventh studio album, Ateş (Fire), was released by DMC on 18 April 2019.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: The album's first music video, "N'apıyorsan Yap", was released on 19 April 2019, four days prior to the album's release on digital platforms.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: It was followed by music videos for the songs "Ağlar O Deli", "Esiyor" and "Yekten".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: In December 2020, Akalın launched her own cosmetic collection under the name DA.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Pırlanta, Rakipsiz and Ateş ===

sentences: Philanthropy ==
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Demet Akalın donated ₺50,000 and ₺10,000 to Mehmetçik Foundation in 2016 and 2017 respectively.

sentences: In 2019, she donated proceeds from her concert at the Cemil Topuzlu Open-Air Theatre to the same charity.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In December 2019, Akalın together with Hande Yener and producer Polat Yağcı had a meeting with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Prevention of child abuse and violence against women were among the discussed topics during the meeting.
